author: Special Correspondent
text: The American College here has been re-accredited with ‘A’ grade, with a cumulative grade point average of 3.46, by National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC). The re-accreditation in the second cycle was approved by the NAAC at the 13{+t}{+h}meeting of its Standing Committee held on March 17. The assessment for re-accreditation was made by a peer team of P. Ramaiah, former VC, Ambedkar Open University (chairman), Sunita Kumbhat of Jodhpur and Deepak Karkun of Chhattisgarh during its visit. The college was given the highest CGPA among 72 institutions all over the country assessed in the second cycle. The NAAC peer team, according to a release from M. Davamani Christober, Principal, recommended that the institution can apply for College with Potential for Excellence status.
title: The American College re-accredited with ‘A’ grade
